messages.msgSnippet: LOL..of course.  Keiran is pretty happy with anyone.  Hey, with the whole Harry Potter craze I think it is great for kids to see boys and girls can be such
messages.messageBody:
LOL..of course. Keiran is pretty happy with anyone. Hey, with the
whole Harry Potter craze I think it is great for kids to see boys and
girls can be such good friends! We will have to find you guys
there!! I wonder how easy it is for everyone to meet up? I mean
from the list, we should have a unschooling.com pow-wow! LOL

Olga :)

>
> hope that helps!

> Marji

Laura D

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Who is coming to the conference
messages.msgSnippet: ... I ll be there, too, with my sweet 8-year-old elevator-hijacking son, Liam. We were there last year and it was GREAT!  It was wild to be in a space with a
messages.messageBody:
At 13:22 5/10/03 -0400, you wrote:
>In a message dated 5/10/2003 11:04:49 AM Eastern Standard Time,
>genant2@... writes:
>
> > >So I am just being nosy <g>, who is going to the conference??

I'll be there, too, with my sweet 8-year-old elevator-hijacking son, Liam.
We were there last year and it was GREAT! It was wild to be in a space
with a couple of hundred people I had never met face to face yet I felt
like I really knew everyone and felt so at home in their company. It was
like a family reunion only without any stress and everyone there you really
WANT to see! As Karin suggested, it was kind of cool to be amongst people
where unschooling and respectful parenting were the norm. I can't wait to
get back to my "people" again!

Marji


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Who is coming (Laura D)
messages.msgSnippet: ... No, you don t pay now, but you must reserve your room now, and you need a credit card to reserve the room, but the credit card doesn t get charged until
messages.messageBody:
At 13:22 5/10/03 -0400, Laura D. wrote:
>In a message dated 5/10/2003 11:04:49 AM Eastern Standard Time,
>genant2@... writes:
>
> > >So I am just being nosy <g>, who is going to the conference??
>
>We would like to go but im wondering about a hotel room. Do they make you pay
>now?
>
>
>Laura D
>Who will be bringing 3 children, -hubby who has to work : (

No, you don't pay now, but you must reserve your room now, and you need a
credit card to reserve the room, but the credit card doesn't get charged
until you actually get there and pay. And, you can pay some other way, if
you don't want to use the card (i.e., pay with cash or some other card). I
hope that helps!

Marji

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Who is coming to the conference
messages.msgSnippet: ... You don t know me because I haven t been posting lately (just reading and being really busy), but I m going to the conference in SC and so is my whole
messages.messageBody:
>So I am just being nosy <g>, who is going to the conference??

>Olga :) >>

You don't know me because I haven't been posting lately (just reading and
being really busy), but I'm going to the conference in SC and so is my whole
family! My husband and kids included. I went last year and it was so great.
I loved mingling among all those people who unschool just like us - not
being the oddball out like usual. I loved hearing all the speakers (and was
sad to miss Sandra but visited her in the hospital, anyway!) and I kept
thinking to myself "my husband should be here to hear all this, too". And
it'll be so great to have my boys playing with and making friends with other
unschooled kids. We are really looking forward to it. Can't wait!

Karin in Phoenix, AZ
Mom to Ben (12) and Jonny (10)

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Who is coming to the conference
messages.msgSnippet: Hello to all! I m a new member to the list and to unschooling (we ll wrap-up traditional classroom method in June, take a break, and start living with
messages.messageBody:
Hello to all!

I'm a new member to the list and to "unschooling"
(we'll wrap-up traditional classroom method in June,
take a break, and start living with unschooling for
life [or until God directs us differently] this fall.)

Anywho, could you please post more info on the
conference, such as dates, location, and/or website?

Thank you,
Monica
(Mom of Christian 10 yrs, Chloe 15 mos)
Wake Forest, NC
